channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12984] SSL cannot be used by the InfoPort after removing deprecated code in HBASE-10336
item.description:
Setting hbase.ssl.enabled to true doesn't enable SSL on the InfoServer. Found that the problem is down the InfoServer and HttpConfig in how we setup the protocol in the HttpServer:


for (URI ep : endpoints) {

        Connector listener = null;

        String scheme = ep.getScheme();

 if ("http".equals(scheme)) {

          listener = HttpServer.createDefaultChannelConnector();

        } else if ("https".equals(scheme)) {

          SslSocketConnector c = new SslSocketConnectorSecure();

          c.setNeedClientAuth(needsClientAuth);

          c.setKeyPassword(keyPassword);

It depends what end points have been added by the InfoServer:


builder

      .setName(name)

      .addEndpoint(URI.create("http://" + bindAddress + ":" + port))

      .setAppDir(HBASE_APP_DIR).setFindPort(findPort).setConf(c);

Basically we always use http and we don't look via HttConfig if hbase.ssl.enabled was set to true and we assign the right schema based on the configuration.
item.summary: SSL cannot be used by the InfoPort after removing deprecated code in HBASE-10336

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Enis Soztutar do you want to give it a try?

This looks like good one for 1.0.0 Enis Soztutar if you've not cut the RC yet.

Yes. We had a offline thread with Esteban on this. I saw this yesterday and decided to wait for this for the RC. I should have updated here in the thread, my b.
I lack the sufficient background to review this patch. Stack, Andrew Purtell do you mind a review.

Esteban Gutierrez Have you tried it Esteban? Connecting on https? If so +1.

nit: review, the policy data member shouldn't be static (and why is it not POLICY if static – not your fault)?
nit: Does the test prove https is possible? Isn't it just checking regionserver came up?

I tried to test it myself but having some trouble getting past:

Caused by: java.io.IOException: !JsseListener: java.lang.NullPointerException

It causes us to fail startup. Looks like HDFS-3059 and its complaint that ssl-server.xml is required but we don't seem to load ssl-server.xml anywhere.

Was following these instructions: http://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP2/HDP-2.1.3/bk_reference/content/ch_wire-https.html Looks like we have a bit of a hole in our refguide hereabouts.

Maybe you have more luck Esteban Gutierrez?

You were right stack we don't load ssl-server.xml or ssl-client.xml. I'm adding both resource manually if the HBase configuration enables SSL. Tried this new patch on a distributed cluster and seems fine. I might add a new test case to use a client to connect using SSL to a RS just to confirm that it was successful, current test only verifies that the cluster was started correctly.

@enis commit it so you can roll RC? This effects ssl only and story needs a bit of teasing out. Seems like this patch makes the situation better but more to do.

Jonathan Lawlor Timeouts for TestChoreService seem to have triggered. Lets take a look at it tomorrow.
Ok, lets commit this one for the RC.
I have pushed this. Thanks Esteban for the patch. You mind doing follow up jiras for the remaining work?
